creator: samee_m@hotmail.com
text:
i am unable compile apache2.0.47 on solaris2.8. any ideas what could be wrong 
here. 
thanks

make[2]: *** [/usr/users/x/source/httpd-2.0.47/server/exports.lo] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/local/users/x/source/httpd-2.0.47/server'
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/local/users/x/source/httpd-2.0.47/server'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

When 'server/export_files' is created, it is appended to in 2 ways; using Solaris
'pwd' and ksh's pwd.  If you access your source tree via a symlink, those results
are different, and you get each definition twice, leading to the build errors.
My src is usually accessed via symlink, /usr/cns/src/unsupported/apache.  My
actual working dir is /Net/cnssrc/usr/cns/src/unsupported/apache.  export_files
ends up with entries for both locations:
/Net/cnssrc/usr/cns/src/unsupported/apache/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr-util/include/apr_anylock.h
/usr/cns/src/unsupported/apache/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr-util/include/apr_anylock.h

schaper@colorado.edu
10/7/03 9:52am
creator: schaper@colorado.edu
trawick@apache.org
text:
work-around: don't use a build directory that is accessed via symlink :(

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8867 ***
